mythology_story: According to Mesopotamian mythology, the Scorpion-Men were created by Tiamat , the primordial goddess of the salt sea and chaos, to serve in her army against the younger gods. In the Enuma Elish (the Babylonian creation epic), Tiamat, enraged by the death of her consort Apsu, creates eleven monsters to wage war against the gods: After Marduk defeated Tiamat and established the cosmic order, these creatures were not destroyed but reassigned to serve protective functions, guarding sacred places and boundaries. Thus the Scorpion-Men transformed from warriors of chaos to sentinels of divine order.
